channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2024010355
item.description:
Report E-2024010355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ reported a 5-ounce release of UN1230 Pro Methanol from a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 65-gallon poly drum. Contractors were dispatched to place the drum into a compatible container. Contractors arrived onsite and advised they did not observe a release to the poly overpack. The damaged drum was removed from the poly overpack, patched, and re-overpacked into an 85-gallon metal drum. The poly overpack the drum was staged in was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum as a precaution. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010363
item.description:
Report E-2024010363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Klean Strip Acetone (UN1090) was released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging (missing lid). The release impacted the concrete at dock door 110. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 55-gallon DM containing one 5-gallon metal pail of Klean Strip Acetone and oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010480
item.description:
Report X-2024010480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A STYROFOAM PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 523E3F, WREA, 225 LITTLETON RD., MORRIS PLAINS NJ 07950-2927.

item.title: Report E-2024010154
item.description:
Report E-2024010154

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: BRANCHBURG
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was leaking during transit and released approximately three (3) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the UN1993-impacted trailer. FCE then replaced the bung on top of the drum. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010208
item.description:
Report X-2024010208

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO SAFELY REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF ISOPROANOL LIQUID LEAKED OUT DUE TO ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAVING A LOOSE CAP. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING 1 CUP OF ISOPROPANOL LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QUICKLY AND SAFELY TAKING THE WET PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT. AFTERWARDS REPACKING IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SHIPPED TO DISCARD PROPERLY.

item.title: Report X-2024010214
item.description:
Report X-2024010214

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package left at QA; unsure of original discovery point. Package inspected by morning QA upon arrival to warehouse in AM. Package leaked into plastic bin it was originally placed in; upon discovery, items were separated from box and placed into new red hazmat bin with new plastic liner. Upon inspection, 1 gallon can Milesi Polyurethane topcoat had fully leaked into and through box. NOTE: Other items in pkg are hazmat items as well, but did not leak. DescribePack: Outer package is unpunctured/not torn or outwardly damaged, but very wet/sticky from internal leak. Outer package appears to have had hazmat stickers/some remnants of them are visible, but all labeling and stickers have melted off of box/been damaged to the point of unreadability. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery, package was inspected and items separated from sticky/damaged outer packaging. All inner items and packaging placed in a red hazmat bin with plastic bag liner.

item.title: Report X-2024010257
item.description:
Report X-2024010257

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010257 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package of "BRANSON EC FORMULATED CLEANING CONCENTRATE" to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, with 1 of 4 items missing, and 1 of 4 with a loose cap. Damage most likely from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated. 2. X-2024010264 SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SORT 4 X 1 GALLON BRANSON PLASTIC bottle. Two of the caps were loose and caused leakage which damaged the outer and inner packaging allowing 20% spillage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.
